quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks:
[!raw!]
<form>
   <{0} type="text" name="name" />
</{1}>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]HTML5 Forms[/h1]

HTML5 brings many features and improvements to web form creation. There are new attributes and input types that were introduced to help create better experiences for web users.

Form creation is done in HTML5 the same way as it was in HTML4: [code format="html" codeId="64"]<form>
   <label>Your name:</label>
   <input id="user" name="username" type="text" />
</form>[/code]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to auto focus on the input and create a placeholder:
[!raw!]
<form>
<input type="text" name="name"
{0}="Enter your name"
{1} />
</form>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]New Attributes[/h1]

HTML5 has introduced a new attribute called [b]placeholder[/b]. On <input> and <textarea> elements, this attribute provides a hint to the user of what information can be entered into the field. [code format="html" codeId="65"]<form>
   <label for="email">Your e-mail address: </label> 
   <input type="text" name="email" [b]placeholder[/b]="email@example.com" /> 
</form>[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2563" width="100%"]
The [b]autofocus [/b]attribute makes the desired input focus when the form loads: [code format="html" codeId="66"]<form>
   <label for="e-mail">Your e-mail address: </label> 
   <input type="text" name="email" [b]autofocus[/b]/>
</form>[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2564" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: Designate the username field as required, and focus on the name field when the page loads: [!raw!]
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Forms with Required Fields [/h1]

The "[b]required[/b]" attribute is used to make the input elements required. [code format="html" codeId="67"]<form [b]autocomplete[/b]="[b]off[/b]">
   <label for="e-mail">Your e-mail address: </label>
   <input name="Email" type="text" [b]required [/b]/>
   <input type="submit" value="Submit"/>
</form>[/code]
The form will not be submitted without filling in the required fields.

[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2565" width="100%"]
[note]The [b]autocomplete [/b]attribute specifies whether a form or input field should have autocomplete turned on or off.
When autocomplete is on, the browser automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before.[/note]

[b][u]HTML5 added several new input types:[/u][/b]
- color
- date
- datetime
- datetime-local
- email
- month
- number
- range
- search
- tel
- time
- url
- week

[b][u]New input attributes in HTML5:[/u][/b]
- autofocus
- form
- formaction
- formenctype
- formmethod
- formnovalidate
- formtarget
- height and width
- list
- min and max
- multiple
- pattern (regexp)
- placeholder
- required
- step
[note]Input types that are not supported by old web browsers, will behave as input type text.[/note]
